pr_title: Move tools for indexing to TaskToolbox instead of injecting them in constructor

timeline.message: Move tools for indexing to TaskToolbox instead of injecting them in constructor

timeline.bodyText: Could this be javax.annotation.Nonnull instead? That seems more common in the codebase, and these objects don't really seem "monotonic"
timeline.author: jon-wei

replies.bodyText: I think Nonnull and MonotonicNonNull are different. The javadoc of Nonnull says "The annotated element must not be null. Annotated fields must not be null after construction has completed.", while the one of MonotonicNonNull says "Indicates that once the field (or variable) becomes non-null, it never becomes null again.". For the variables annotated as MonotonicNonNull in this class, they are nulls when the class is constructed and initialized later in runTask(). Once they are initialized, they never become nulls again until the task is finished. So, I think MonotonicNonNull is more proper for these variables.
replies.author: jihoonson

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see, that's good then
replies.author: jon-wei

timeline.bodyText: Is this class currently used anywhere?
timeline.author: jon-wei
